title: Access Learning Modules
description: As a user, I want to be able to browse and select different learning modules based on my interests and current knowledge level so that I can follow a structured path to learn AI concepts.
acceptance_criteria: User can view a list of available learning modules categorized by topic (e.g., ML Basics, LLM Basics, Advanced GenAI, Building LLMs from Scratch).
Each module displays a brief description and an indicator of its difficulty level or prerequisite knowledge.
User can click on a module to view its detailed content.
Users can filter or search for specific modules.

title: View Concept Explanations and Visualizations
description: As a learner, I want to view clear, bite-sized explanations of AI concepts accompanied by interactive visualizations and real-world analogies so that I can understand complex topics easily.
acceptance_criteria: When viewing a module, concepts are broken down into small, digestible sections.
Each core concept includes a simple, relatable analogy.
Interactive visualizations (e.g., graphs, diagrams, animations) are displayed for relevant mathematical concepts and AI model architectures.
Visualizations allow for basic user interaction like hovering for details or zooming.
Explanations avoid overly technical jargon where possible.

title: Integrate Code Examples
description: As a user learning AI, I want to see relevant code snippets within the learning modules, with clear explanations, so that I can understand how theoretical concepts are implemented in practice.
acceptance_criteria: Code examples (primarily Python) are embedded directly within the relevant learning content.
Each code snippet is accompanied by a brief explanation of what the code does.
Users can easily copy the code snippets.
Code examples use common AI/ML libraries (e.g., Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, LangChain).

title: Utilize Flashcards for Review
description: As a learner, I want to create and review flashcards using a spaced repetition system so that I can effectively reinforce my learning and improve knowledge retention.
acceptance_criteria: Users can select text or concepts within modules to create flashcards.
The system automatically generates flashcards for key terms and definitions.
Users can initiate a flashcard review session.
The system presents flashcards based on a spaced repetition algorithm.
Users can rate their recall difficulty (e.g., 'Easy', 'Good', 'Hard') to influence future review scheduling.
Review history is tracked.

title: Track Learning Progress
description: As a user, I want to track my progress through the learning modules and review history so that I can see my achievements and stay motivated.
acceptance_criteria: The system tracks which modules and lessons a user has completed.
Quiz scores (if implemented) are recorded.
Flashcard review activity is logged.
A dashboard visually displays the user's overall progress, completed modules, and any earned badges or milestones.
Users can easily resume learning from where they left off.

title: Create and Manage User Account
description: As a user, I want to create an account to save my progress and preferences across different sessions and devices.
acceptance_criteria: Users can sign up using email/password or OAuth providers (Google, GitHub).
Users can log in to their existing accounts.
User progress, flashcard data, and settings are securely stored and associated with their account.
Password reset functionality is available.

title: Receive Personalized Recommendations
description: As a user, I want to receive personalized recommendations for the next modules or topics to learn so that I can optimize my learning path.
acceptance_criteria: The system analyzes user's completed modules, quiz performance, and stated interests.
Personalized recommendations for subsequent learning content are presented on the user's dashboard.
Recommendations aim to guide users towards their stated goals (e.g., job readiness, specific AI areas).

title: Take Module Quizzes
description: As a learner, I want to take quizzes at the end of modules to test my understanding so that I can confirm my comprehension before moving on.
acceptance_criteria: Each learning module or a group of related modules concludes with a short quiz.
Quizzes consist of multiple-choice or short-answer questions based on the module content.
Users receive immediate feedback on their quiz performance.
Quiz scores are recorded and contribute to the user's overall progress tracking.

title: Access Glossary of AI Terms
description: As a user, I want to easily look up definitions of AI terms I encounter so that I can clarify any jargon or unfamiliar concepts.
acceptance_criteria: A dedicated glossary section is available within the platform.
The glossary contains definitions for key AI terms used across the modules.
Terms within the learning content are hyperlinked to their corresponding glossary definitions.
Users can search the glossary.

title: Access Content on Mobile Devices
description: As a user, I want to access AI Navigator on my mobile phone or tablet so that I can learn on the go.
acceptance_criteria: The web application interface is fully responsive and adapts to different screen sizes (desktop, tablet, mobile).
All features and content are accessible and usable on mobile devices.
Interactive visualizations perform well on smaller screens.

title: Experience a Simplified LLM Simulator
description: As a user exploring advanced LLM concepts, I want to interact with a simplified simulator to understand the impact of different parameters so that I can grasp the intuition behind LLM architecture.
acceptance_criteria: A conceptual simulator is available for specific LLM-related modules.
Users can adjust a limited set of high-level parameters (e.g., 'creativity', 'model size' - represented abstractly).
The simulator provides visual or textual feedback demonstrating the *conceptual* impact of parameter changes on LLM behavior.
The focus is on understanding relationships, not on actual model training or complex math.

title: Use Interactive Coding Sandboxes
description: As a user, I want to run and modify code examples directly within the platform in an interactive sandbox so that I can experiment with code hands-on without setting up a local environment.
acceptance_criteria: Code examples are presented within an integrated code editor/sandbox environment.
Users can execute the code directly from the sandbox.
Users can modify the code and re-run it to observe changes.
The environment supports the necessary libraries for the provided code snippets.

title: Participate in Community Forums
description: As a user, I want to connect with other learners and ask questions in a community forum so that I can get help and share insights.
acceptance_criteria: A forum or Q&A section is available for users to post questions and comments.
Users can reply to posts and engage in discussions.
Content can be categorized or tagged for easier navigation.
Moderation tools are in place.

title: Obtain Certificates
description: As a user who has completed a learning path, I want to receive a verifiable certificate so that I can showcase my acquired knowledge.
acceptance_criteria: Specific learning paths or course bundles are designated for certification.
Upon successful completion (e.g., passing all quizzes), users are issued a digital certificate.
Certificates contain unique identifiers and can be shared (e.g., via URL or PDF).
Certification may be part of a premium subscription or a one-time purchase.

title: Access Advanced Math Explanations
description: As a user interested in the deep theoretical underpinnings, I want to access more detailed mathematical explanations linked from core concepts.
acceptance_criteria: Specific concepts within the modules have links to 'Advanced Math Details'.
These sections provide deeper dives into the mathematical theorems, proofs, or derivations.
Explanations are clearly marked as optional and supplementary.
Content is well-formatted for mathematical notation.

title: Access Multi-language Content
description: As a global user, I want to access the learning content in my preferred language so that I can learn more effectively.
acceptance_criteria: The platform supports multiple languages.
Users can select their preferred language from a settings menu.
Core learning module content, UI elements, and potentially explanations are translated.
Language switching is seamless.
